trans-unit.source: Append a line of text to the end of a previously opened text file.

seg-source.mrk: Append a line of text to the end of a previously opened text file.

target.mrk: Append a line of text to the end of a previously opened text file.

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen(). Alternatively, you may use a string filename as the first parameter.

seg-source.mrk: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen().
Alternatively, you may use a string filename as the first parameter.

target.mrk: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen().
Alternatively, you may use a string filename as the first parameter.

trans-unit.source: The line of text to write to the text file. If the line does NOT end in @CR or @LF then a DOS linefeed (@CRLF) will be automatically added.

seg-source.mrk: The line of text to write to the text file.
If the line does NOT end in @CR or @LF then a DOS linefeed (@CRLF) will be automatically added.

target.mrk: The line of text to write to the text file.
If the line does NOT end in @CR or @LF then a DOS linefeed (@CRLF) will be automatically added.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: 0 if file not opened in writemode, file is read only, or file cannot otherwise be written to.

seg-source.mrk: 0 if file not opened in writemode, file is read only, or file cannot otherwise be written to.

target.mrk: 0 if file not opened in writemode, file is read only, or file cannot otherwise be written to.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The text file must be opened in write mode or the FileWriteLine() command will fail.

seg-source.mrk: The text file must be opened in write mode or the FileWriteLine() command will fail.

target.mrk: The text file must be opened in write mode or the FileWriteLine() command will fail.

trans-unit.source: If a filename is given rather than a file handle, the file will be opened and closed during the function call. For parsing large text files this will be much slower than using filehandles. However, filename will be created if it does not already exist.

seg-source.mrk: If a filename is given rather than a file handle, the file will be opened and closed during the function call.
For parsing large text files this will be much slower than using filehandles.
However, filename will be created if it does not already exist.

target.mrk: If a filename is given rather than a file handle, the file will be opened and closed during the function call.
For parsing large text files this will be much slower than using filehandles.
However, filename will be created if it does not already exist.

trans-unit.source: Note: Do not mix filehandles and filenames, i.e., don't FileOpen() a file and then use a filename in this function. Either use filehandles or filenames in your routines, not both.

seg-source.mrk: Note:
Do not mix filehandles and filenames, i.e., don't FileOpen() a file and then use a filename in this function.
Either use filehandles or filenames in your routines, not both.

target.mrk: Note:
Do not mix filehandles and filenames, i.e., don't FileOpen() a file and then use a filename in this function.
Either use filehandles or filenames in your routines, not both.

trans-unit.source: When writing text AutoIt will write using UTF8 (without BOM) by default. To write in another mode the file must be opened with FileOpen() and the relevant flags.

seg-source.mrk: When writing text AutoIt will write using UTF8 (without BOM) by default.
To write in another mode the file must be opened with FileOpen() and the relevant flags.

target.mrk: When writing text AutoIt will write using UTF8 (without BOM) by default.
To write in another mode the file must be opened with FileOpen() and the relevant flags.

trans-unit.source: The text to write cannot contain Chr(0) characters as the output is truncated. FileWrite() using a file opened in binary mode must be used to write such characters.

seg-source.mrk: The text to write cannot contain Chr(0) characters as the output is truncated.
FileWrite() using a file opened in binary mode must be used to write such characters.

target.mrk: The text to write cannot contain Chr(0) characters as the output is truncated.
FileWrite() using a file opened in binary mode must be used to write such characters.
